title: Circular Motion - Frequency of toy car

content.description: Four toy cars move on circular tracks, one of which is shown in the figure. The cars travel around the tracks at various constant speeds on tracks of various constant radii.
content.question: In which of the following figures does the motion of the car have the greatest frequency?

choices.label: The figure shows a top view of a car moving at 6.0 meters per second counterclockwise on a circular track. The track has a radius of 4.0 meters.
The figure shows a top view of a car moving at 8.0 meters per second counterclockwise on a circular track. The track has a radius of 6.0 meters.
The figure shows a top view of a car moving at 9.0 meters per second counterclockwise on a circular track. The track has a radius of 8.0 meters.
The figure shows a top view of a car moving at 8.0 meters per second counterclockwise on a circular track. The track has a radius of 12.0 meters.

content.answer: The figure shows a top view of a car moving at 6.0 meters per second counterclockwise on a circular track. The track has a radius of 4.0 meters.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
